## Species behaviour in monoculture stands {.smaller}

::::: columns
::: {.column .center width="50%"}
-   Scots Pine grows well on poor soils, uniform stands, and have a high drought and pest vulnerability.
-   European Beech dense canopy and quality timber, drought sensitive, limited regeneration on dry sites.
-   Sessile Oak: valuable hardwood, requires light, regeneration difficult, risk from insects. Norway Spruce: fast growth, high yield, prone to storms and bark beetles.
:::

## Synergies in mixed stands

![](images/interactions.png){fig-align="center"}

## Trade off and competition on mixed stands

-   Beech/Pine: Beech overtops pine over time
-   Oak/Beech: Oak needs more light.
-   Spruce competes with beech for moisture because it performs poorly on dry soils.
-   There is the need for proper management to balance competition and maintain mixture stability.

**Key point**: from Pine monoculture to resilient mixed forest

# Modeling

## Timeframe

50 Years = 11 Periods

| Species         | N / ha | G (m²) |
|-----------------|--------|--------|
| Scots pine      | 282    | 31     |
| European beech  | 525    | 9      |
| Norway spruce   | 28     | .6     |

## Thinning parameters {.center}

## BAS - Business as usual

-   No Management

## SIAFI - Set it and forget it

### Future Crop Trees

| Parameter Class | Parameter            | Value   |
|-----------------|----------------------|---------|
| Frequency       | Thinning periods     | 5 years |
| Intensity       | Release radius       | 4 m     |
|                 | Max. thinning volume | 150 m³  |

## SIAFI - Set it and forget it

| Species        | Future Crop Trees [^2] / ha | Thinning regime        |
|----------------|-----------------------------|------------------------|
| Scots pine     | 80                          | light                  |
| European beech | 22                          | heavy                  |
| Norway spruce  | 0                           | light                  |
| Sessile oak    | 40                          | no direct thinning[^3] |

[^2]: $(N\ \text{Future trees monoculture})_i \times (\text{Target proportion})_i$ // $i = Species$

[^3]: Summand = 0

## HE - High effort

### Selective thinning

| Parameter Class | Parameter                | Value    |
|-----------------|--------------------------|----------|
| Frequency       | Thinning periods         | 5 years  |
| Intensity       | Tree numbers             | variable |
|                 | Max. thinning volume     | 150 m³   |
|                 | A-Value                  | Strong   |
|                 | Species thinning regimes | = SIAFI  |
